title: [CVE-2018-18312] regcomp: heap-buffer-overflow write / reg_node overrun
content:
See: https://rt.perl.org/Public/Bug/Display.html?id=133423
CVE ID: CVE-2018-18312
Impact
Potential RCE
steps: Identify a target system using Perl's regular expression engine (regcomp) that is vulnerable to heap buffer overflow.
Craft a malicious regular expression pattern that triggers a heap buffer overflow during compilation (regcomp phase).
vuln_description: The vulnerability is a heap buffer overflow in Perl's regcomp (regular expression compilation) function, which can be exploited by crafting a malicious regular expression pattern. This overflow can lead to arbitrary code execution (RCE) due to improper bounds checking when processing certain regex patterns.
reason: The vulnerability involves understanding the internals of Perl's regex compilation process and crafting a pattern that triggers the overflow. While the attack is straightforward once the pattern is known, discovering the exact pattern requires deep knowledge of Perl's regex engine internals.
